comment.body: @Blurhy: interpreting is like compiling at very every run. Why it won't be slower? Also bytecode is not native code, so it won't solve this completely.

@Blurhy: it's Fidonet, the oldest and still alive (and still with some dial-up nodes) mostly Russian (but historically American) social media.
They started to use interpretable PL-written SW (like jNode, wFido and Hotdoged) just recently and still have compilable alternatives.
So optimistic! When it'll begin in Russia?
Ffuck... Looks like the lockdown can really do like on the pic.
@Realjohndoe: Hope he does deserve such words.
